verses.roman:
yuga-dharma pravartāimu nāma-saṅkīrtana
cāri bhāva-bhakti diyā nācāmu bhuvana

synonyms: yuga-dharma—the religion of the age; pravartāimu—I shall inaugurate; nāma-saṅkīrtana—chanting of the holy name; cāri—four; bhāva—of the moods; bhakti—devotion; diyā—giving; nācāmu—I shall cause to dance; bhuvana—the world.
translation: "I shall personally inaugurate the religion of the age-nāma-saṅkīrtana, the congregational chanting of the holy name. I shall make the world dance in ecstasy, realizing the four mellows of loving devotional service.
